intro: Myoda rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed myoda, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Myoda rufescens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
